p: Favipiravir is a nucleoside analog that can lead to lethal viral mutagenesis, chain termination or the inhibition of nucleotide biosynthesis [ 70]. Favipiravir in combination with oseltamivir, which was given to patients infected with SARS-CoV-2, has been used to treat severe influenza [ 45]. Oseltamivir, a neuraminidase inhibitor, is recommended as an antiviral treatment for influenza and has been widely used to inhibit COVID-19 in China [ 45, 70]. Other neuraminidase inhibitors, zanamivir and peramivir, are also effective treatments for MERS-CoV [ 71]. At this time, these are all empirical therapies for COVID-19. However, whether oseltamivir or zanamivir are effective treatments for COVID-19 also needs further study.
